name: Avoid using 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()'
description: This rule reports Java artifacts using 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()'
output:
This report lists all java artifacts using 'java.lang.Runtime.exec'.
It provides the following information:
 - Artifact full name
rationale:
For portability reasons, 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()' should not be used since it means being dependent on the environment where the application is deployed.
For security reasons, 'java.lang.Runtime.exec()' can lead to malicious file execution resulting in devastating attacks such as total server compromise.
reference:
Open Web Application Security Project's Top Ten
http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Top_10_2007-A3
see OWASP_Top_10_2007_for_JEE.pdf
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/ProcessBuilder.html
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/77
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/78
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/88
https://www.sans.org/top25-software-errors/#cat1
remediation: Alternative to java.lang.Runtime.exec(), we can also make use of java.lang.ProcessBuilder which makes it much easier to specify a process, set up its environment, spawn it, and handle its file descriptors.
